data.title: Monokai theme - C functions are green instead of blue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 Home Premium
- Theme: Monokai
- Language: C

Hello coders, I recently updated the editor to version 1.11.2 and I noticed that the Monokai theme has changed. In every previous version the function names were coloured in blue, and now they're green. I must admit that I don't like the green. Can I somehow change it back to blue? Thank you in advance.

![2017-04-20 22_23_08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1208707/25251098/6caf8122-2618-11e7-9d23-f71d81cbb318.png)

Used to be blue:

![2017-04-20 22_27_19-2017-03-10 16_56_51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1208707/25251143/9420e93a-2618-11e7-810f-f0f1cb55aa87.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a ,c file and set the workbench theme to "Monokai"
2. Now check how functions are colored

data.title: Command to open the old keybindings.json side-by-side view
data.body:
Since I manage my keybindings.json file in a dotfiles repo I would prefer to open the old view and work with the text files so I can manage the format/when clauses manually.

An additional command to do this is probably better than I setting imo, that way I we don't really need a switch view button up the top.

data.title: Autocomplete in Visual Studio Code not working correctly (SASS,CSS,LESS)
data.body: When using VSC the autocomplete function does not seem to work correctly. I can use things like bgc for background-color: but when i want the options for a property it just gives a list with all the options. I have made two screenshots to show the behaviour. I use Sass Indented as a plugin. Edit: Autocompletion does work with a normal css file.

data.title: Provide for cancellation of extension download

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18.1

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Go to extensions (Ctrl+Shift+X).
2. Search for "@sort:installs" (or any other query that shows extensions you do not have installed).
3. Click the green install button next to an extension.

**Actual Results:**

Button "dims" and changes the displayed text to "Installing" until the extension has been installed.

**Desired Behavior:**

A cancel button appears or at least clicking on the "Installing" button opens a menu with a cancel option.

**Rationale:**

Install can be hit accidentally, [extensions can be large](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18146), and in many places bandwidth is still capped/limited; thus, it would be nice to have a recourse other than exiting VS Code to abort the download.

data.title: Implement blank operations
data.body:
Please consider implementation of the following features, shown here in notepad++.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4483325/25244389/219ad5bc-25c6-11e7-94d2-a55eda78f3ba.png)

the tab to space/space to tab feature is very convenient. In my case, i prefer tabs, but company style guidelines dictate 2 spaces. I can easily convert to tabs, edit a file then convert to spaces and commit changes. I like VS Code, but i would prefer to have this feature available to me in VS Code. Bonus points if you can make configurable keyboard short cuts.

data.title: [C#]"ctor+TAB+TAB": Generates constructor BUT fails to caption the actual class name & instead displays generic text "ClassName(Parameters)"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.11.2
Commit 6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
Date 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
Extension: C Sharp (C#)
dotnet sdk runtime: 1.0.0-preview2-003131

- OS Version:
OS Name	Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
Version	10.0.14393 Build 14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a Class File with name **TestClass**
2. Focus the Mouse Cursor inside the **TestClass**
3. Type ctor and hit TAB twice (ctor + tab + tab)
4. Verify that constructor get created with name set as public **TestClass**()

Actual Behavior:
constructor get created with name set as public **ClassName(Parameters)**

Expected Behavior:
constructor should get created with name set as that of its containing class i.e. public **TestClass()**

Note: Please refer the attached file named "vscode_ctor.PNG
"
![vscode_ctor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/27440077/25240419/6d6447e6-25fb-11e7-85c8-1f77bb76526e.PNG)

data.title: Formatting document and renaming variables no longer working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11
- OS Version: archlinux latest

Formatting the document (using Ctrl-Shift-I) and renaming variables (using F2) are no longer working. It's not just the keyboard shortcuts that stopped working, the functionality doesn't work through the menu either. It stopped working a few months ago, possibly after an update but I'm not sure.

When I format the document, nothing changes, whereas before it used to indent the code appropriately. When I rename a variable using F2, nothing changes, and a progress bar appears at the top of the screen and the only way to remove it is to restart vscode.

I tried to reinstall vscode but the problem remains. I also tried disabling all the extension I'm using but the problem also remains. I have a minimal and straightforward user settings json file so I'm not sure if anything there could be causing this issue.

Is there anything I can try to fix it like clearing some cache or starting from scratch somehow?

data.title: Feature Request: Alternative Language ID for Extensionless files
data.body:
I have some configuration files, (they happen to be ruby) but the files themselves do not have an extension. And so I have to manually select the language type, each time I open the files. 

Because the files do not have an extension, there automatic language association fails.

Can VS Code, perhaps parse a shebang line to determine the file type?
Or, can we have some VS code specific way to identify the files? perhaps by name (without extension) in some configuration file?

Git file diff viewer: accept/discard chunks of code

When on git diff view, It would be great if it would be possible to undo or accept partials chunks of code!
Just the same way sourcetree does!

data.title: problemMatcher support multiline messages
data.body:
It would be nice be able to setup a custom problem matcher for commands that output multiline problems. For example Ruby RSpec.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup a task to run rspec (example: [tasks.json](https://gist.github.com/raldred/987065e5a167d2c569407b85d14b47be) )
2. Write a failing test
3. Observe failings in the output but no problems detected.

The failure and the offending files are not on the same line in the RSpec file.
This may be beyond the scope of the problemMatcher but it would be a really nice addition if possible.
Maybe an option in the pattern config to switch to multiline mode where the full output is used against the pattern.


Example output from RSpec with 2 failures.
```
Failures:
  1) Evohome::Client#new sets up the account info
     Failure/Error: username = options.fetch(:username)
     KeyError:
       key not found: :username
     # ./lib/evohome/client.rb:9:in `fetch'
     # ./lib/evohome/client.rb:9:in `initialize'
     # ./spec/evohome/client_spec.rb:12:in `new'
     # ./spec/evohome/client_spec.rb:12:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
  2) Evohome::Connection#new configures faraday
     Failure/Error: expect(faraday).to receive(:new)
     NameError:
       undefined local variable or method `faraday' for #<RSpec::ExampleGroups::EvohomeConnection::New:0x007fed22b039b8>
     # ./spec/evohome/connection_spec.rb:6:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
Finished in 0.00192 seconds (files took 0.14868 seconds to load)
3 examples, 2 failures
Failed examples:
rspec ./spec/evohome/client_spec.rb:9 # Evohome::Client#new sets up the account info
rspec ./spec/evohome/connection_spec.rb:5 # Evohome::Connection#new configures faraday
```

data.title: Missing button for deleting individual watches
data.body:
VSCode: 1.11.2

What has happened to the "X" button in watches?

Previously (I'm not sure exactly what versions, but at least v1.7), it was possible to click a cross button to the right of each individual watch expression to remove it. Now it seems the only way to delete an individual watch is to edit it to a blank string - this is a bit tedious.

Was this removed on purpose? If not, could you put them back please.

data.title: [Extension] Allow users to use custom icons over sets?
data.body:
Hi there,

I’ve published an icon set (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=emmanuelbeziat.vscode-great-icons). I had a feature request by a user: https://github.com/EmmanuelBeziat/vscode-great-icons/issues/46

Basically, he asks me if it would be possible for him to define custom icons that would override my list. I’m giving it a real thought, because I think it would be a great improvement.

I now that it wouldn’t be possible to just define some custom file and folder, as the update process of vscode is to remove the old extension folder and create a new one.

I don’t see if there’s a way to use (contributes.configuration)[https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/extension-points#_contributesconfiguration] and define custom files for some icons, and then kindda "import" theses adds in my script? At this point, I’m just wondering if this is possible in any way or not.

The user suggested this:

> I guess another option is to have a piece of code that runs offline to merge the new and old versions. Is there any way to run code on installation, ala Squirrel? 

I need confirmation about this, ’cause I didn’t find anything relevant on the doc: is this possible to run a script before the installation / update of a plugin?

Thanks for your thoughts :)

data.title: Scroll up/down with touchpad does not work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Handlebars|andrejunges|0.2.0|
|ACF-Snippet|anthonydiametrix|1.7.2|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|1.1.5|
|php-pack|felixfbecker|1.0.1|

|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.0.1|

|searchdocsets-vscode|silverlakesoftware|0.5.2|
|wordpress-snippet|tungvn|1.1.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.VS Code open
2.On any view with a scroll bar, using the touchpad with two fingers to scroll up/down, no action.
